unnormalised: CBSE announces the Class 10th and 12th board exam dates for the academic year 2024-25. The exams for Class 10 will commence on 15/02/2025 and conclude on 20/03/2025, while the Class 12 exams will be held from 15 Feb 2025 to 10 April 2025. Students are advised to visit the official website cbse.nic.in for the detailed timetable and exam guidelines.
normalised: C-B-S-E announces the Class tenth and twelfth board exam dates for the academic year two thousand twenty four two thousand twenty five. The exams for Class ten will commence on fifteenth February two thousand twenty five and conclude on twentieth March two thousand twenty five, while the Class twelve exams will be held from fifteenth February two thousand twenty five to tenth April two thousand twenty five. Students are advised to visit the official website c b s e dot n i c dot in for the detailed timetable and exam guidelines.

unnormalised: This year, over 30 lakh students are expected to appear for the Class 10th and 12th exams nationwide. The board has implemented several measures to ensure fair and smooth conduct of the examinations, including increased CCTV surveillance and strict adherence to the exam hall regulations. Students are reminded to carry their admit cards and school ID cards to the exam center. Reporting time is 8:30 AM for a 9:30 AM start.
normalised: This year, over three million students are expected to appear for the Class tenth and twelfth exams nationwide. The board has implemented several measures to ensure fair and smooth conduct of the examinations, including increased C-C-T-V surveillance and strict adherence to the exam hall regulations. Students are reminded to carry their admit cards and school I-D cards to the exam center. Reporting time is eight thirty A-M for a nine thirty A-M start.

unnormalised: The CBSE board has also announced that the evaluation process will be standardized to maintain uniformity and accuracy in marking. The board aims to declare the results by the 2nd week of May 2025. Students can access their results online using their roll number and date of birth. Good luck to all the students appearing for the exams!
normalised: The C-B-S-E board has also announced that the evaluation process will be standardized to maintain uniformity and accuracy in marking. The board aims to declare the results by the second week of May two thousand twenty five. Students can access their results online using their roll number and date of birth. Good luck to all the students appearing for the exams!
